heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 19 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (187°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.7 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 218 m), pressure (up 12 mbar), and rainfall (up 0.7 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 6443 lux), cloud levels (up 885 m), rainfall (down 0.2 mm), and dew point temperature (down 1.6°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 218.5m lower than yesterday, 584.2m lower than the past week, 885.2m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 572m to 1380m and averaged 677.6m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be low, possibly causing overcast or foggy conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, air moisture should feel ok and near calm conditions. Showers, cloud cover will be low, possibly causing overcast or foggy conditions, and it’s dark. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
